frameDefinitions: A Theme that is in motion assumes a new Direction in which it moves.
In this frame an Evaluee is described by a (usually implicit)
An Accused individual is deemed by a (usually implicit)
An Experiencer feels bad about a choice, an Action, or a failure to do something, which they now consider to have been a mistake or wrong.
Temporary or permanent Styles and Configurations of Hair, as well as its inherent Nature.
An Item is in a state of dryness.
frameExamples: We took our chances and <t>turned</t> right by a petrol station and, bingo, there she was--Fir Park.
That was very <t>righteous</t> of you to help him.
I am <t>innocent</t> of this crime and so is James Griffiths .
Smithers did not <t>repent</t> of his crime.
On either side her head gleamed coiled <t>braids</t> of dark-gold hair , almost pale copper in the subdued light of the room .
listRoleDefinitions: This is the object which moves. In many sentences this role will be expressed as something which moves under its own power. However, this role is not <ment>required</ment> to be an animate mover, so it is different from a self-mover.
The new direction in which the <fen>Theme</fen> continues its motion.
The time at which the change of direction takes place.
The <fen>Place</fen> is the setting where the change of direction during the Theme's motion occurs.
This is the person whose <fen>Behavior</fen> is being judged with respect to its morality.
The assessment of the <fen>Evaluee</fen> is based on his or her <fen>Behavior</fen>.
The <fen>Expressor</fen> is the body part or action by a body part which is the basis of the evaluation of morality.
This is the person who is accused of a  <fen>Misdeed</fen>.
The wrongful act which  the <fen>Accused</fen> was purportedly involved in.
The role <fen>Experiencer</fen> indicates the person who experiences the emotion about their prior action.
The role <fen>Action</fen> marks expressions that indicate a prior action that the <fen>Experiencer</fen> has come to feel bad about.
The role <fen>Expressor</fen> marks expressions that indicate a gesture or body part which is displaying the <fen>Emotional_state</fen> of the <fen>Experiencer</fen>.
The role <fen>Emotional_state</fen> is modified by an adjective  that indicates the <fen>Experiencer</fen> is contrite.
The <fen>Time</fen> at which the <fen>Experiencer</fen> or the <fen>Expressor</fen> is contrite.
This role is the hair itself
This role is the Possessor of the body part.
Temporary Configurations of hair (eg braid, bun, ponytail).   Something done to the hair merely by movement.
A property of the hair (eg curly, fine, brown).  This acts much like 'Descriptor' in the Observable_bodyparts Frame.  Colors, styles, natural properties are described by this frame element.
The <fen>Item</fen> exists in a state of dryness.
listRoleExamples: At that point <fex>the truck in front of me</fex> turned right into the huge ditch/field that separates the interstate from the access road.
Eventually, though, I backtracked to Kel Tole and hung a <fex>left</fex> toward Kilgal Tole.
Turn right <fex>at the stop light</fex> and follow Park Avenue.
It was honorable <fex>of Jackie</fex> to give up the position.
<fex>Accepting that money</fex> was immoral of Lindsay.
His face twisted into an evil <fex>grin</fex>
<fex>Frank Quattrone</fex> is found guilty of obstructing federal investigations
Cambridge woman says she's innocent <fex>of fraud</fex>.
They confessed and repented <fex>their actions against the Soviet Union</fex>.
Martha had a guilty <fex>conscience</fex> after selling inferior merchandise.

sourceCandidateSpans.text: ECFA's Seven Standards of Responsible Stewardship
